CEO Elon Musk has been touting these self-driving Teslas for years, and he claims they are on track for the June 2025 rollout .  Wedbush Securities analyst Daniel Ives has long been highly bullish on Tesla’s growth prospects . Earlier this year, even Ives started expressing some skepticism about the company's future . This prompted Ivesto reducehis TSLA stock price target to $315 per share from $500, a significant decrease . Now that Musk seems to be shifting his focus back to Tesla, Ives’ outlook on the company has improved .  Tesla has a lot riding on its fast-approaching robotaxi launch, as Ives’ new take on the company illustrates . Ives also addressed the concern regarding Tesla’s struggling sales in Europe, stating that while the company still has some work to do, his team still believes that “the AI Revolution is now coming to Tesla”  The momentum for the upcoming event is significant, and the stock's performance over the past month has been strong . While Tesla seems to be on track for the launch, its robotaxis won’t be fully self-driving . Morgan Stanley analyst Adam Jones revealed that it will feature “a lot of tele-operators” after visiting the company’s office .  Tesla is set to enter a new chapter and will help boost share prices in both the long and short term . The company is set for an exciting new chapter in the U.S.
